name: Delphi
summary: A cinematic React + TypeScript application that blends multiple divination modes—AI-guided chat, tarot, numerology, horoscope wheel, dreams, runes, and more—into a cohesive, animated digital oracle experience. Built as a cloud-native product with a scalable AWS backend.
contributions: Designed the full cloud architecture using AWS serverless services and GraphQL-first principles
Implemented multi-mode divination experiences with animated UI surfaces and React Router 7
Set up local cloud simulation using LocalStack for DynamoDB, AppSync, and S3 development
Built reading history, saved profiles, and planned Cognito-based authentication flows
outcomes: Achieved smooth 60 FPS UI animations across multi-page flows with Framer Motion
Reduced backend boilerplate by adopting a unified GraphQL AppSync schema
Enabled scalable user-personalized readings via DynamoDB + Lambda pipelines

context.audience: End users seeking personalized AI experiences
constraints: Solo development of a large multi-system product
Balancing animation-heavy UI with performance targets

name: Web Crawler
summary: A full-stack web application that processes and analyzes submitted URLs, generating structured data such as HTML version, headings, links, and login form detection. Includes real-time crawl progress, a dashboard, and Playwright end-to-end tests.
contributions: Developed the backend crawler in Go using Gin, implementing status polling and real-time progress updates
Built the full React dashboard with bulk actions, visual data panels, and responsive design
Containerized the entire system using Docker Compose and configured local dev orchestration
Created comprehensive Playwright tests for crawling workflows and UI validation
outcomes: Delivered structured crawl results with accurate login-form detection and link classification
Implemented a stable crawling pipeline capable of handling multiple parallel requests
Improved dashboard responsiveness using optimized React state slices and memoization

context.audience: Technical users needing structured website insights
constraints: Maintaining performance under multiple concurrent crawls
Handling websites with inconsistent HTML structure
Coordinating backend crawling and frontend polling

name: German Reading Exercises
summary: A full-stack EdTech application that generates AI-backed reading passages, comprehension checks, and progress tracking. Users authenticate, study daily content, look up vocabulary, and build long-term reading habits.
contributions: Architected the GraphQL API using Yoga and Prisma for clean schema-driven development
Implemented spaced repetition logic for reading difficulty and progress tracking
Designed a clean, mobile-first interface for reading, quizzes, and vocabulary lookups
Integrated OpenAI to generate context-aware reading passages and summaries
outcomes: Reduced query complexity by normalizing reading-level metadata in Prisma models
Delivered consistently formatted AI passages using custom prompt engineering
Built a responsive and accessible UI that supports long reading sessions

constraints: Optimizing AI generation for consistent difficulty
Ensuring fast UX on a lightweight SQLite backend

name: German Practice
summary: A full-stack language learning platform with flashcards, multiple-choice quizzes, JWT authentication, AI-powered content generation, and progress tracking. Runs on serverless GraphQL functions with a PostgreSQL database.
contributions: Built serverless GraphQL endpoints using Vercel functions for scalable low-latency requests
Modeled progress data with PostgreSQL + Prisma for long-term study tracking
Implemented JWT authentication for secure user sessions across devices
Created AI-powered flashcard and quiz generators tailored to user difficulty
outcomes: Improved serverless cold-start times by bundling functions efficiently
Enabled personalized study sessions based on historical correctness data
Delivered a smooth, interactive UI optimized for quick-paced reviewing

constraints: Ensuring consistent AI output for quiz formats
Balancing serverless execution limits with GraphQL workloads

name: Pathfinder
summary: An interactive visualization tool that generates mazes and computes the shortest path using the A* algorithm. Built with React, Canvas, and TypeScript for smooth real-time rendering.
contributions: Implemented recursive backtracking maze generation with configurable density
Built a clean React UI layered over a Canvas-based rendering pipeline
Rendered the step-by-step A* pathfinding process with smooth animations
Managed interaction logic for placing start/end nodes and regenerating mazes
outcomes: Achieved high frame rates even on large 40×40 grids with optimized redraw logic
Created a clear visual demonstration of pathfinding fundamentals
Improved algorithmic understanding through visual debugging tools

constraints: Avoiding unnecessary re-renders during animation frames

name: Personal Chatbot
summary: A single-page React app that answers questions about you using your custom JSON profile. Runs on a Vercel serverless API that uses OpenAI to generate context-aware responses.
contributions: Built a serverless API that injects personal structured data into OpenAI prompts
Designed the chat interface using React 19 with smooth, accessible interactions
Added speech recognition and markdown output for a polished experience
Created the data model used to ground responses with consistent personal details
outcomes: Provides recruiters an interactive, always-online summary of your background
Ensures answer accuracy by grounding responses in structured JSON
Delivers a fast, frictionless UX on a single-page interface

constraints: Ensuring AI responses stay truthful and grounded
